text.section:
In addition to any duties set forth elsewhere, the Secretary shall adopt and enforce regulations to carry out this title, including regulations that establish:
minimum standards for electronic equipment capable of monitoring 24 hours per day individuals who are under a court order that requires monitoring by a private home detention monitoring agency;
minimum training and experience requirements for a private home detention monitoring agency licensee and for a private home detention monitor; and
the minimum number of private home detention monitors that shall be on duty in relation to the number of defendants being monitored.

The Secretary shall:
maintain a roster of licensed private home detention monitoring agencies that includes:
a telephone number at which a person who operates a licensed private home detention monitoring agency can be reached during normal business hours; and
a telephone or pager number at which a person who operates a licensed private home detention monitoring agency can be reached during nonbusiness hours;
annually disseminate the roster of licensed private home detention monitoring agencies to:
the administrative judge for the District Court in each district;
the administrative judge for the circuit court in each county; and
the Administrative Office of the Courts; and
notify the agencies listed in paragraph (2) of this subsection when the license of a private home detention monitoring agency is suspended or revoked.
